project.teaser: Nature Robots is a pioneering startup founded in 2022, spearheading a revolution in agriculture with its fully autonomous farming system, led by CEO Dr. Sebastian Pütz. Backed by €2.1 million in funding, the company aims to transform agriculture by reducing greenhouse gas...
project.objective: Nature Robots is a pioneering startup founded in 2022, spearheading a revolution in agriculture with its fully autonomous farming system, led by CEO Dr. Sebastian Pütz. Backed by €2.1 million in funding, the company aims to transform agriculture by reducing greenhouse gas emissions, enhancing biodiversity, and decentralizing food supply. Nature Robots aims to develop an autonomous full farming system that integrates resilient autonomous navigation technology with hardware robotics, operated from a base station, enabling farmers to implement regenerative practices and cut costs by up to 80%. With a team of around 10 professionals specializing in robotics, AI, software engineering, agriculture, and business development, supported by seasoned advisors, Nature Robots is poised to lead the way in scalable deep-tech solutions for vegetable farming. Their innovative system, comprising Autonomous Navigation, Weed and Crop Monitoring, Agronomic Planning, and Lero Robot & Implements, leverages AI and robotics to address the diverse needs of farmers in different climates and soils. Nature Robots' commitment to advancing regenerative agriculture through cutting-edge technology positions them as a leader in the field. In this EIC project, Nature Robots aims to request Blended Finance with €2.5M of grant financing and €4M equity financing. This enables Nature Robot to bring the full farming system to TRL8 and ensure scalability.
project.title: Autonomous Full Farming for Optimised Regenerative and Wholesome Agriculture with Robotics and Deep-Learning
project.keywords: Regenerative agriculture, autonomous navigation, full farming system, regenerative farming, market garden, community support agriculture

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
